attachmentHtml:
PC Number: 2009-0421

Date: 2009-03-23

   Her Excellency the Governor General in Council,

on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 108(1) of the Financial Administration Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of Hugh MacDiarmid, President and Chief Executive Officer, Atomic Energy of Canada Limited, as set out in the schedule hereto, which remuneration is within the range ($327,800 - $385,700), effective April 1, 2008.

 

   Her Excellency the Governor General in Council,

on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 108(1) of the Financial Administration Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of Robert G. Van Adel, former President and Chief Executive Officer, Atomic Energy of Canada Limited, as set out in the schedule hereto, which remuneration is within the range ( $322,200 - $378,100), effective November 2, 2007.

 

   Her Excellency the Governor General in Council,

on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 3.1(2) of the Canadian Commercial Corporation Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of Marc Whittingham, President, Canadian Commercial Corporation, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 4 ($197,800 - $232,700), effective September 4, 2008.


   Her Excellency the Governor General in Council,

on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 3.1(2) of the Canadian Commercial Corporation Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of Marc Whittingham, former Acting President, Canadian Commercial Corporation, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 4 ($197,800 - $232,700), for the period commencing April 1, 2008 and terminating September 3, 2008.

 

   Her Excellency the Governor General in Council,

on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 7(1) of the Cape Breton Development Act, hereby fixes the salary of Ross Farquharson McCurdy, President, Cape Breton Development Corporation, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range ($160,800 - $189,200), effective April 1, 2008.

 

   Her Excellency the Governor General in Council,

on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 43(1) of the Broadcasting Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of Hubert Lacroix, President, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation, at the rate set out in the schedule hereto, which rate is within the salary range CEO 7 ($341,700 - $402,000), effective April 1, 2008.


   Her Excellency the Governor General in Council,

on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 43(1) of the Broadcasting Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of Robert Rabinovitch, former President, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation, at the rate set out in the schedule hereto, which rate is within the Crown Corporation Group 9 salary range ($322,200 - $379,100), effective December 31, 2007.

 

   Her Excellency the Governor General in Council,

on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 108(1) of the Financial Administration Act and section 7 of the Crown Corporation General Regulations, 1995, hereby fixes the salary of Charles Chrapko, President and Chief Executive Officer, Blue Water Bridge Authority, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 1 ($114,500 - $134,700), effective September 1, 2008.

 

   Her Excellency the Governor General in Council,

on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 6(3)(c) of the Bank of Canada Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of Mark J. Carney, Governor, Bank of Canada, as set out in the schedule hereto, which remuneration is within the range ($405,500 - $441,700), effective February 1, 2008.


   Her Excellency the Governor General in Council,

on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 6(3)(c) of the Bank of Canada Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of David A. Dodge, former Governor, Bank of Canada, as set out

in the schedule hereto, which remuneration is within the range

($405,500 - $477,100), for the period commencing January 1, 2008 and terminating January 31, 2008.

 

   Her Excellency the Governor General in Council,

on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 6(3)(c) of the Bank of Canada Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of W. Paul Jenkins, Deputy Governor, Bank of Canada, as set out

in the schedule hereto, which remuneration is within the range

($283,900 - $334,000), effective January 1, 2008.

 

   Her Excellency the Governor General in Council,

on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 3.1(2) of the Canadian Commercial Corporation Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of John McBride, former President, Canadian Commercial Corporation, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the Crown Corporation Group 5 range ($176,500 - $207,700), effective September 30, 2007.


   Her Excellency the Governor General in Council,

on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 6(1) of the Canada Council Act, hereby fixes the salary of Robert Sirman, Director, Canada Council for the Arts, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 4 ($197,800 - $232,700), effective April 1, 2008.

 

   Her Excellency the Governor General in Council,

on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 7(2) of the Canada Mortgage and Housing Corporation Act, hereby fixes the salary of Karen Kinsley, President, Canada Mortgage and Housing Corporation, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 7 ($341,700 - $402,000), effective January 1, 2008 and

June 16, 2008.

 

   Her Excellency the Governor General in Council,

on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 23(5) of the Museums Act, hereby approves the remuneration of Victor Rabinovitch, Director, Canadian Museum of Civilization, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 4 ($197,800 - $232,700), effective April 1, 2008.


   Her Excellency the Governor General in Council,

on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 108(1) of the Financial Administration Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of Mark B. Laroche, President and Chief Executive Officer, Canada Lands Company Limited, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range ($206,300 - $242,700), effective April 1, 2008.

 

   Her Excellency the Governor General in Council,

on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 3(5) of the Canadian Dairy Commission Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of John Core, Chief Executive Officer, Canadian Dairy Commission, as set out in the schedule hereto, which per diem rate is within the range

($805 - $945), for the period commencing August 1, 2008 and terminating October 6, 2008.

 

   Her Excellency the Governor General in Council,

on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection

8(2) of the Canada Post Corporation Act, hereby fixes the salary of

Moya Greene, President, Canada Post Corporation, as set out

in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range

CEO 8 ($410,000 - $482,400), effective January 1, 2008.


   Her Excellency the Governor General in Council,

on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 108(1) of the Financial Administration Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of Ross Nicholls, President and Chief Executive Officer, Defence Construction (1951) Limited, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 3 ($164,800 - $193,900), effective April 1, 2008.

 

   Her Excellency the Governor General in Council,

on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 31(1) of the Enterprise Cape Breton Corporation Act, hereby fixes the salary of John Lynn, Chief Executive Officer, Enterprise Cape Breton Corporation, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 2 ($137,400 - $161,600), effective June 1, 2008.

 

   Her Excellency the Governor General in Council,

on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 31(1) of the Enterprise Cape Breton Corporation Act, hereby fixes the salary of Marlene Usher, former Acting Chief Executive Officer, Enterprise Cape Breton Corporation, as set out in the schedule

hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 2 ($137,400 - $161,600), for the period commencing April 1, 2008 and terminating May 31, 2008.


   Her Excellency the Governor General in Council,

on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 108(1) of the Financial Administration Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of Guy Saint-Pierre, President and Chief Executive Officer, Canada Deposit Insurance Corporation, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range ($221,100 - $260,100), effective April 1, 2008.

 

   Her Excellency the Governor General in Council,

on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 9(2) of the Export Development Act, hereby fixes the salary of Eric Siegel, President, Export Development Canada, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 6 ($284,800 - $335,000), effective January 1, 2008.

 

   Her Excellency the Governor General in Council,

on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 13(2) of the Business Development Bank of Canada Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of Jean-René Halde, President, Business Development Bank of Canada, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 6 ($284,800 - $335,000), effective April 1, 2008.


   Her Excellency the Governor General in Council,

on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 12(1) of the Canadian Film Corporation Act, hereby fixes

the salary of S. Wayne Clarkson, Executive Director, Telefilm Canada,

as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the

Crown Corporation Group 4 range ($157,700 - $185,500), effective April 1, 2007.

 

   Her Excellency the Governor General in Council,

on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 108(1) of the Financial Administration Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of Greg Stewart, President, Farm Credit Canada, as

set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range

($273,000 - $321,200), effective April 1, 2008.

 

   Her Excellency the Governor General in Council,

on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 108(1) of the Financial Administration Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of John J. Ryan, former President, Farm Credit Canada, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range ($273,100 - $321,300), effective November 22, 2007.


   Her Excellency the Governor General in Council,

on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 108(1) of the Financial Administration Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of Micheline Dubé, Chief Executive Officer, Federal Bridge Corporation Limited, as set out in the schedule hereto, which remuneration is within the range CEO 3 ($164,800 - $193,900), effective April 1, 2008.

 

   Her Excellency the Governor General in Council,

on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to section 6 of the Freshwater Fish Marketing Act, hereby fixes the salary of John Wood, President, Freshwater Fish Marketing Corporation, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range ($143,700 - $169,000), effective May 1, 2008.

 

   Her Excellency the Governor General in Council,

on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to section 9 of the International Development Research Centre Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of David Malone, President, International Development Research Centre, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range ($207,100 - $243,700), effective July 1, 2008.


   Her Excellency the Governor General in Council,

on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to section 9 of

the International Development Research Centre Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of Maureen O'Neil, former President, International Development Research Centre, as set out in the schedule hereto,

which salary is within the range ($207,100 - $243,700), for the period commencing April 1, 2008 and terminating June 30, 2008.

 

   Her Excellency the Governor General in Council,

on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 23(5) of the Museums Act, hereby approves the remuneration of Joanne V. DiCosimo, Director, Canadian Museum of Nature, as set

out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range

CEO 3 ($164,800 - $193,900), effective April 1, 2008.

 

   Her Excellency the Governor General in Council,

on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 108(1) of the Financial Administration Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of John F. Roil, former Acting President and Chief Executive Officer, Marine Atlantic Inc., as set out in the schedule hereto, which remuneration is within the range ($180,100 - $211,900), for the period commencing May 9, 2008 and terminating September 30, 2008.


   Her Excellency the Governor General in Council,

on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 16(1) of the Royal Canadian Mint Act, hereby fixes the salary of Ian E. Bennett, Master of the Mint, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range ($273,000 - $321,200), effective January 1, 2008.

 

   Her Excellency the Governor General in Council,

on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 6(3) of the National Arts Centre Act, hereby fixes the salary of Peter Herrndorf, President, National Arts Centre Corporation, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range ($177,000 - $208,300), effective September 1, 2008.

 

   Her Excellency the Governor General in Council,

on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 23(5) of the Museums Act, hereby approves the

remuneration of Pierre Théberge, former Director, National Gallery of Canada, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 3 ($164,800 - $193,900), for the period commencing April 1, 2008 and terminating January 4, 2009.


   Her Excellency the Governor General in Council,

on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 7(1) of the National Capital Act, hereby fixes the salary of Micheline Dubé, Chief Executive Officer, National Capital Commission, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the Crown Corporation Group 5 range ($176,500 - $207,700), effective January 6, 2008.

 

   Her Excellency the Governor General in Council,

on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 7(1) of the National Capital Act, hereby fixes the salary of Marie Lemay, Chief Executive Officer, National Capital Commission, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range ($206,300 - $242,700), effective April 1, 2008.

 

   Her Excellency the Governor General in Council,

on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 23(5) of the Museums Act, hereby approves the salary of Christopher J. Terry, former Director, National Museum of Science and Technology, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 3 ($164,800 - $193,900), for the period commencing April 1, 2008 and terminating June 21, 2008.


   Her Excellency the Governor General in Council,

on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 108(1) of the Financial Administration Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of R. Anthony McGuinness, Chief Executive Officer, Atlantic Pilotage Authority, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 2 ($137,400 - $161,600), effective January 1, 2008.

 

   Her Excellency the Governor General in Council,

on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 108(1) of the Financial Administration Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of Tony Genco, President and Chief Executive Officer,

Parc Downsview Park Inc., as set out in the schedule hereto, which

salary is within the range ($143,700 - $169,000), effective April 1, 2008.

 

   Her Excellency the Governor General in Council,

on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 108 (1) of the Financial Administration Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of Kevin G. Obermeyer, Chief Executive Officer, Pacific Pilotage Authority, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range

CEO 2 ($137,400 - $161,600), effective January 1, 2008.


   Her Excellency the Governor General in Council,

on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 108(1) of the Financial Administration Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of Réjean Lanteigne, Chief Executive Officer, Laurentian Pilotage Authority, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 2 ($137,400 - $161,600), effective January 1, 2008.

 

   Her Excellency the Governor General in Council,

on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 108 (1) of the Financial Administration Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of Robert Fernand Lemire, Chief Executive Officer, Great Lakes Pilotage Authority, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 2 ($137,400 - $161,600), effective January 1, 2008.

 

   Her Excellency the Governor General in Council,

on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to section 11 of the Canadian Race Relations Foundation Act, hereby fixes the salary of Ayman Al-Yassini, Executive Director, Canadian Race Relations Foundation, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 1 ($114,500 - $134,700), effective April 1, 2008 and September 18, 2008.


   Her Excellency the Governor General in Council,

on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 14(4) of the Standards Council of Canada Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of Peter D. Clark, former Executive Director, Standards Council of Canada, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 3 ($164,800 - $193,900), for the period commencing April 1, 2008 and terminating April 25, 2008.

 

   Her Excellency the Governor General in Council,

on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to section 15 of the Canadian Tourism Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of Michele Mary Anne McKenzie, President, Canadian Tourism Commission, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range

CEO 4 ($197,800 - $232,700), effective January 1, 2008.

 

   Her Excellency the Governor General in Council,

on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 108(1) of the Financial Administration Act, hereby fixes the remuneration of Paul Côté, President and Chief Executive Officer, VIA Rail Canada Inc., as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 5 ($237,300 - $279,200), effective January 1, 2008.
